column4: I want to thank coffee shop owner Melissa Thorsen-Broschat for updating me on their operations, and for sharing her ideas to help get businesses like hers through this pandemic. By working together, I am confident that we can come out of this stronger than ever.

NEW: The House has sent two major pieces of legislation to combat the epidemic of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls (MMIWG) to the President‚Äôs desk to be signed into law. https://t.co/lXEsqx8JtQ

One of the most important things Alaskans can do to ensure that our state is treated fairly is to fill out the Census. Our constitutionally mandated Census only happens once a decade, and the COVID-19 pandemic has made this decade's Census data collection uniquely challenging.

The isolation caused by #COVID19 has put the tragedy of suicide in a greater spotlight. I want you to know that help is available. If you're experiencing suicidal feelings, call the National Suicide Prevention Hotline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Help is available 24/7 at no cost. https://t.co/JoyRmcVHYc
RT @PolchinskiMD: Thank you to @repdonyoung's office, especially Jesse von Stein for discussing Neurology in Alaska during the pandemic and‚Ä¶

This is welcome news for the families who have come to rely on the high-quality health care delivered by our State, community health centers, and various tribal consortia. More: https://t.co/bimEMUaon1 https://t.co/fuFQuJiFHv

I‚Äôm proud to be leading bipartisan legislation w/ @RepJohnYarmuth, @RepDonBacon, and @RepDannyDavis to combat homelessness and ensure that the health, safety, and resiliency of our most vulnerable citizens are protected. Read more about our bill here: https://t.co/ccM9PSW1KF
Housing not only brings improved health outcomes, but it also increases upward mobility and economic certainty.

In AK and across the country, COVID-19 has affected nearly every area of our lives. Some of our nation's most vulnerable populations find themselves already facing housing instability. This pandemic has only made it harder to find work and put a roof over their families' heads. https://t.co/tIe9dF5lIa

In Congress, relationships are crucial; this year, I worked with my colleagues on the Armed Services Committee to include my amendments, which bolster health care, strengthen communications in the Arctic, and take action to turn the tide in the fight against military suicides.

I want America's fighting men and women to know that we have their backs. I'm proud to share that today, I helped the House pass the #FY21NDAA, which includes needed funding for military expenditures, provides a 3.1% military pay raise, and bolsters pandemic preparedness. https://t.co/9UworqE1Gx

Alaska Natives, whether they live in remote corners of AK or in downtown Anchorage, are all too familiar w/ public health emergencies. I'm pleased announce that over $2 mil from @HHSGov is coming to help keep our Native communities healthy. More: https://t.co/lpT7YvTH2F https://t.co/13yhuf3fXz

It‚Äôs always great being back in Southeast! Just wrapped up an interview with @CalebVierkant of the Wrangell Sentinel. We covered a range of issues such as transportation funding, tourism, and COVID-19 relief. Thanks for a great discussion Caleb! @WrgSentinel https://t.co/OW5FLNHwQS
Finally, the bill makes lynching a federal crime, which I have previously supported in the House. In many cases, these high standards are already in practice by Alaska‚Äôs law enforcement agencies.

Yesterday, I had a very productive virtual discussion w/ RESULTS Alaska to discuss a range of global issues, like the elimination of poverty and the ongoing threat of COVID-19. Thank you for taking the time to meet with me via Zoom; I look forward to our continued work together! https://t.co/GTlMooLIGb
Unfortunately, even before the pandemic devastated our coastal communities' economies, many were already struggling to survive.

Alaska is home to more coastline than any other state, and coastal communities have been some of the hardest hit by COVID-19. Healthy coastal and marine habitats are important for our society and our economy. https://t.co/TZkbShvyuE

Healthy oceans are essential to Alaska‚Äôs economy and way of life. I'm grateful to @POTUS and the Administration for working on new strategies and guidelines for ocean mapping and exploration. Read more here: https://t.co/3Fp0wEiKFu https://t.co/o5z0xBZeyU

Our Native communities are in desperate need of safe, clean water, particularly during #COVID19. I recently introduced bipartisan legislation w/@RepOHalleran to make sure our Native communities have access to this critical public health resource. More: https://t.co/YovsnuArQT https://t.co/OuuqCLr5MK

Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is essential to protecting front line workers and stopping the spread of COVID-19. My focus continues to be on ensuring the federal response to this pandemic can meet this critical moment. Here‚Äôs a recent update on PPE made available in AK‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/K5zX98ruD5

Today on #NationalMaritimeDay, we‚Äôre celebrating the hardworking men and women on the front lines of the COVID-19 crisis. They show up every day to ensure that our supply chain is strong. Join us in thanking them for their service to Alaska and the entire nation! https://t.co/RINzNHwtvy

.@USPS is not only constitutionally-mandated, but serves as a vital lifeline to countless Alaskans in rural communities. Letting USPS become insolvent simply isn‚Äôt an option. Read about my recent efforts to protect USPS amid #COVID19: https://t.co/2ET25r5PO1 https://t.co/5lc9RpPCNF

#COVID19 has shown just how important broadband is for our communities. With school, work, & social interaction moving online, we must work to close the digital divide. I intro'd the Universal Broadband Act to help expand broadband for Alaskans. Read more: https://t.co/I1gqwzIdfr https://t.co/1GTJ2NlalU

Each and every day, nurses across our country are risking their own safety to keep our communities safe from COVID-19. On #NationalNursesDay, I hope you‚Äôll join me in taking a moment to thank a nurse in your life for the work they do on our behalf. #ThankYouNurses https://t.co/1U6khLGeBD

NEW: @lisamurkowski, @SenDanSullivan, and I just announced that $20 mil in federal support is on its way to stabilize our critical fishing industry. #COVID19 has disrupted supply chains and severely impacted industries throughout our economy, including Alaska's seafood sector. https://t.co/stkZAyxvcD

Throughout this pandemic, Dr. @annezinkmd has been a guiding light in efforts to keep Alaskans safe. She is a champion for public health, and the tireless around-the-clock efforts of her and her staff have been critical in helping to control the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/apt1JosCeK

Last month, I led my colleagues on a bipartisan letter to @VP calling on the creation of a task force that, in-part, would ensure our rural hospitals receive ample supplies of drugs receiving expedited FDA approval, such as Remdesivir. Read more: https://t.co/yAIlGe08DS

I applaud the FDA for taking the potential of Remdesivir seriously. This drug gives Americans some much-needed hope. But far too often in the medical supply chain, our rural hospitals take a back seat to larger health care systems in the Lower 48.

This week, Dr. Anthony Fauci announced that patients who received #Remdesivir had a 31% faster recovery compared to those taking a placebo. I'm encouraged by media reports that @US_FDA will approve the use of Remdesivir to treat #COVID19 following encouraging scientific trials.

Denali is open once again! Visiting our National Parks while practicing CDC guidelines can certainly be done, and I hope you'll visit Denali for beautiful views and crisp Alaskan air. #FindYourPark https://t.co/vflxTBFl6J

Alaskans,

Under Secretary for Benefits, Dr. Paul R. Lawrence is hosting a veterans tele-townhall on Monday, April 27th at 1pm AKST. The call will be focused on the #COVID19 response and various VA program updates. 

To call-in: 844.227.7557 @VAVetBenefits https://t.co/ugj8KN7nuA

I sent a letter w/colleagues to House Leadership, urging the inclusion of state-legal businesses in federal COVID-19 relief programs. The federal government shouldn‚Äôt be endangering the livelihoods of state-legal cannabis operators and employees.
COVID-19 has shined a spotlight on our outdated cannabis policies. After being deemed essential in many states, legal cannabis businesses have been shut out of #smallbiz relief from the #CARESAct.

COVID-19 has changed the way we live our lives, but we all must remember that physical isolation doesn‚Äôt have to mean social isolation. If you‚Äôre feeling depressed, alone, or in danger, help is just a phone call away. Please share these resources with those who may need them. https://t.co/cny5BT7RPx

The COVID-19 pandemic continues to impact families across our country, not only in terms of their physical wellbeing, but also their financial health. Countless families in Alaska have been forced to stay home or laid off, but the bills continue piling up.
BREAKING: I helped the House pass the CARES Act ‚Äì emergency COVID-19 legislation that has now been signed into law by @POTUS.  https://t.co/EfOeBoXnHI

#COVID19's impact is very real, growing, and causing all of us to adjust our habits as the situation changes. Weeks ago, I didn't fully grasp the severity of this crisis, but clearly, we are in the midst of a public health emergency. Stay safe Alaska! https://t.co/hsyTri24bU

Read our letter to @VP urging the establishment of two task forces to combat COVID-19. One to expedite the development of vaccines, and a second to address medical supply shortages in Alaska and across the country: https://t.co/Bvy0a4CHqM

Time is of the essence. Medical supply shortages and bureaucratic red tape threaten not only Americans‚Äô access to necessary medical equipment, but may also be making the development of COVID-19 vaccines more difficult.

Good to hear from @POTUS today on boosting transparency in health care. Surprise medical bills ‚Äì whether for prescription drugs or for a hospital stay ‚Äì have affected too many of my constituents, and I applaud President Trump for his commitment to ending these unfair practices.

In Congress,  I‚Äôve proudly helped secure increased funding to ensure our VA Health Care facilities have the resources necessary to provide mental health services to our veterans. I‚Äôll keep working to provide our nation‚Äôs heroes with the support they need to heal.
